item.title: THE CUBE, SAVE US ‘Server Slam Test’ set for February 19 to 22
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Upcoming extraction action game from XLGAMES.

XLGAMES will host a “Server Slam Test” for extraction action game THE CUBE, SAVE US from February 19 to 22, the company announced. It will be available for PC via Steam.

Here is an overview of the game, via XLGAMES:

The “Server Slam Test” is a large-scale test designed to simulate a live-service environment using a launch-level build, allowing many players to participate simultaneously. The primary goal of the test is to verify server stability and identify critical bugs. While some content will be limited, the test aims to provide a gameplay experience that closely resembles the live service. The Server Slam Test will run for 72 hours, from February 19, 2026, 18:00 p.m. to February 22, 2026, 18:00 p.m. (PDT).

The test build will feature a variety of new content previously introduced in developer notes. This includes the new boss mutant “Yacha,” along with newly added normal and elite mutants, and the implementation of an elite / boss-exclusive equipment system. In addition, players can experience enhanced anti-cheat measures, user interface / user experience improvements based on player feedback gathered during Steam Next Fest, overall optimization updates and new cosmetic content.

THE CUBE, SAVE US previously gained significant attention during Steam Next Fest, achieving 3rd place in peak concurrent players and “Top 8” in the global popular demo rankings. Taking these results into account, XLGAMES plans to further refine the game’s overall quality through the Server Slam Test.

Meanwhile, XLGAMES has scheduled Steam Early Access for Q1 2026. The upcoming Server Slam Test will serve as a final comprehensive evaluation of both service stability and gameplay quality ahead of Early Access.

A release date for THE CUBE, SAVE US has yet to be announced.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/the-cube-save-us-server-slam-test-set-for-february-19-to-22
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: This Week’s Japanese Game Releases: Arknights: Endfield, Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade for Xbox Series and Switch 2, more
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Smartphone
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Dynasty Warriors: Origins for Switch 2, SEGA Football Club Champions 2026, etc.

Arknights: Endfield for PlayStation 5, PC, iOS, and Android, and Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade for Xbox Series and Switch 2 are the highlights of this week’s Japanese video game releases.

Also due out this week are Dynasty Warriors: Origins for Switch 2, as well as the major downloadable content “Visions of Four Heroes” for all platforms, and SEGA Football Club Champions 2026 for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, PC, iOS, and Android.

Get the full list of this week’s Japanese game releases below. It should be noted that Gematsu will receive a small percentage of money from purchases made through Play-Asia links. You can also save five percent with our multi-use “GEMATSU2025” coupon code.

Physical and Digital

  • Dynasty Warriors: Origins (Switch 2) – Game-key card. Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2)
    • European Version (Switch 2)
    • Asian Version (Switch 2)
  • Farming Simulator: Signature Edition (Switch 2) – Game-key card. Already available worldwide.
  • Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade (Switch 2) – Game-key card. Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2)
    • European Version (Switch 2)
    • Asian Version (Switch 2)
  • Telenet Fuku-Bukuro (Switch)
  • Tormented Souls II (PS5) – Already available worldwide.
  • UN:LOGICAL (Switch)
    • Revelation Box (Switch)

Digital-Only

  • 2XKO (PS5, Xbox Series, PC) – Launching worldwide.
  • Arknights: Endfield (PS5, PC [Launcher, Epic Games Store], iOS, Android) – Launching worldwide.
  • Dustland Delivery (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • Ebola Village (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • Eldegarde (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Escape from Ever After (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade (Xbox Series, PC [Microsoft Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Hextreme Void (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • HoloDungeon: Koyori vs. Hollow Live in Honsha Tower Early Access (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • MAVRIX Early Access (PS5, Xbox Series) – Launching worldwide.
  • MIO: Memories in Orbit (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • MOCHI-O (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Ridge Racer (PS5, PS4) – Launching worldwide.
  • The Rumble Fish 2 (Switch 2) – Launching worldwide.
  • Sainthood (PS5, PS4) – Launching worldwide.
  • SEGA Football Club Champions 2026 (PS5, PS4, PC [Steam], iOS, Android) – Launching worldwide.
  • Silt (iOS, Android) – Launching worldwide.
  • Touhou: Blossom Blade (Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.

The PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch titles listed above can be purchased through Japanese PlayStation Network and Nintendo accounts using prepaid cards:

  • PlayStation Store cards (yen): 1,100 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 10,000
  • Nintendo eShop cards (yen): 1,000 / 1,500 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 9,000

Demos, DLC, Updates, etc.

  • Code Vein II Character Creator Demo (PS5, Xbox Series, PC)
  • Cult of the Lamb Expansion “Woolhaven” (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC)
  • Dynasty Warriors: Origins Major Downloadable Content “Visions of Four Heroes” (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PC)
  • No Rest for the Wicked Early Access Update “Together” (PC)
  • One Piece: Pirate Warriors 4 Downloadable Content “Special Selection Pack (Character Pack No. 8)” (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC)

item.title: Ketsu Battler adds Narmaya from Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Both Narmaya and Beelzebub now available.

Ketsu Battler, the one-on-one butt shaking fighting game, has added Narmaya from Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising as a free guest character today alongside the previously announced Beelzebub via its version 4.0 update, developer KAYAC announced.

Ketsu Battler is available now for Switch in Japan.

Watch a new trailer below.

Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising Collaboration Character Narmaya Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/ketsu-battler-adds-narmaya-from-granblue-fantasy-versus-rising

item.title: Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising DLC character Ilsa launches February 10
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5

Boot camp begins now.

Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising Character Pass Season 2 downloadable content character Ilsa will launch on February 10 for $7.99 / 880 yen alongside the game’s version 2.50 update, publisher Cygames and developer Arc System Works announced.

Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising is available now for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and PC via Steam.

Watch a new trailer below.

DLC Character Ilsa Release Date Trailer

Japanese
